result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Alan Altpeter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Jail term is with huber privileges.

Submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Cooperate with mental health treatment as directed by agent, department of human services or any mental health professional, includes taking medications as prescribed and only in the amount and manner prescribed.
Price County Sheriff's Dept. (PCSD) case #14-1014 is dismissed and read in for purposes of restitution.

$725.50 J&S w/Danielle Drinka to Shear Elegance
$52.00 uncharged PCSD Case #14-1014 to James Henningfeld (not J&S)
$1000.00 to Medford Cooperative not (J&S)

timeConds.notes: Jail term is to commence immediately.

records.addlTxt:
1:16 pm - Defendant Steven Alan Altpeter in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed revocation packet. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Comments and recommendation by DA. Comments by Atty. Richards. Comments by DE. Comments and ruling by Court. Court provides written explanation of determinate sentence. Appeal rights given. Adj. 1:31 pm.
Court imposes (Ct. 1): 7 year prison term conisisting of 4 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision with credit for 346 days credit. DE is eligible for CIP and SAP.  Conditions: Reimpose all prior monetary obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 22, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven Alan Altpeter
Current: 349 8th Avenue S., Apt. 4, Park Falls, WI 54552 United States  (Effective: 07-30-2015)
Prior: 601 N Summit Ave, c/o New Hope Shelter, Crandon, WI 54520 United States

1:52 pm - Defendant Steven Alan Altpeter appeared with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received and reviewed information and waive reading.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 1.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 and on motion of DA dismisses and reads in Ct. 2 and uncharged PCSD Case #14-1014 for purposes of restitution.  Comments by parties.  Comments and ruling by Court.  Court imposes (Ct. 1):  Sentence withheld - 3 years probation.  Conditions:  9 month jail term, with huber privileges, to commence 03-31-15, with credit for 222 days served; $268 CC; $250 DNAAS and submit DNA sample; $1777.50 Restitution + 10% surcharge of $177.50 = $1955.25 (consisting of $725.50 J&S w/Danielle Drinka to Shear Elegance; $52.00 uncharged case to James Henningfeld; $1000 to Medford Coop.); Apology; Cooperate with mental health treatment as directed by agent or Dept. of Human Services or any mental health professional including taking medications as prescribed, only in the amount and manner prescribed.  Appeal rights given.  Adj. 2:14 pm.
